entry.title: Gate Group Expands Payment Offerings With New Visa Debit Card Rollout In Europe
entry.summary:
Gate Group, the company behind the popular exchange Gate.io, plans to launch a European crypto debit card to expand its reach to European countries.Â Users can seamlessly convert and spend their crypto assets with the card in everyday purchases.Â
One of the factors that push adoption in the crypto space is continuous developments. As each firm operating in the sector expands its reach to different countries, more users will join the industry, increasing knowledge and eventual adoption.Â
Gate.io Debit Card To Push AdoptionÂ
Gate Group plans to launch the card with the support of its Lithuania-based company Gate Global UAB. According to a Twitter post, the card will enable users to complete crypto-to-fiat conversions for online and in-store purchases.
It will make the process fasterâ€¦

entry.title: Regulator Warns Crypto Investors Against â€œProof Of Reserveâ€ Reports, Says It Canâ€™t Be Trusted
entry.summary:
While the intervention of regulators in the crypto industry could sometime seem unnecessary or frightening, it is worth noting that not all regulators are villains, some are just keen on consumer protection.Â
On Wednesday, the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB), an industry-funded watchdog working under the authority of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) published an advisory report addressing the so-called â€œProof of Reserveâ€ crypto firms reveals to customers to prove solvency.
PCAOB Addresses â€œProof Of Reserveâ€ Reports
Proof of Reserve, also known as PoR, is a type of report industry firms such as crypto exchanges and stablecoin issuers have been using over the past months since the FTX crash, to tout their protection against bank runs.Â
While crypto firmsâ€¦

After Silvergate Bank announced its voluntary liquidation, U.S. senator Elizabeth Warren is attributing the financial institutionâ€™s downfall to â€œcrypto risk.â€ According to Warren, she had previously warned about Silvergate. However, some critics are dismissing Warrenâ€™s opinion as â€œterribly misinformedâ€ and claim that she is â€œtossing out egregious accusations.â€

Hours after Silvergate Bank announced its liquidation, U.S. senator Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) tweeted about the financial institutionâ€™s demise. Warren once again referred to cryptocurrencies as risky and expressed disappointment about Silvergateâ€™s failure, which she deemed â€œpredictable.â€

entry.title: Dogecoin, Shiba Inu Record Double-Digit Losses Amid Market Uncertainty
entry.summary:
Dogecoin and Shiba Inu have had a tough go of it lately. Given that these are digital assets that are largely driven by hype, the decline in interest in the crypto market has greatly affected their performance. Amid all of these, both of these meme coins are now some of the highest losses among the largest cryptocurrencies in the space.
Dogecoin And Shiba Inu See Large Losses
Over the last week, most cryptocurrencies in the market are down significantly from their January peaks. Among these are Dogecoin and Shiba Inu, both of which have seen their losses climb into the double-digit territory in a seven-day period.
Data from CoinGecko shows that Dogecoin, the largest meme coin by market cap, is down 12.8% in the last week, completely stripping its gains from the prior week. It is noâ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers: MATIC, SOL Fall to Lowest Point Since January
entry.summary:
Polygon fell to its lowest point since January earlier in todayâ€™s session, as overall sentiment in crypto markets remained bearish. Overall, the global market cap is now down 1.46% as of writing. Solana also slipped on Thursday, as the token neared a two-month low.
Polygon (MATIC)
Thursday saw polygon (MATIC) drop to its weakest point since January, as sentiment in the market remained bearish.
Following a high of $1.11 on Wednesday, MATIC/USD moved to a bottom at $1.04 earlier in todayâ€™s session.
The last time polygon traded at this level was back on January 26, which is the last time price was under $1.00.
Looking at the chart, this comes as the relative strength index (RSI) of 14 days fell to a long-term floor at 35.00
As of writing, the index has since rebounded and is at the 36.59 mark, with the next visible point of reference being 42.00.
Overall, bulls have moved in to buy the earlier dip, and as of writing MATIC is trading at $1.07.
Solana (SOL)
Solana (SOL) was another victim of Thursdayâ€™s red wave, as the token also fell to a multi-month low.
SOL/USD found a bottom at $18.20 earlier today, which comes a day after it resided at a high of $19.33.
Similar to polygon, this sell-off pushed the token to its weakest point since January, with prices now down by over 15% in the past week.
Honing in on the chart, the RSI is now tracking at 33.96, which is its weakest reading since the start of the year.
However, after seven days in the red, SOL has marginally rebounded, after appearing to find a floor at the $18.50 mark.
Should this floor hold firm in the coming days, then there is a good chance that bulls could attempt to recapture the $20.00 mark.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
What do you believe is behind todayâ€™s sell-off? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Mt. Gox Creditors Can Now file For Claims Until April
entry.summary:
In a recent development, the Rehabilitation Trustee has pushed the registration deadline for claims against Mt. Gox for another month. The deadline was initially set for March 10 but will now be April 6, 2023.
Mt. Gox was once the largest Bitcoin exchange in the world, but in 2014, it suffered a massive hack that resulted in the loss of 850,000 BTC. The hack devastated the cryptocurrency community, and Mt. Gox declared bankruptcy shortly after.Â
Since then, a long and complicated legal process has been underway to determine how the remaining assets of Mt. Gox should be distributed among creditors.Â
Mt. Gox Creditors Claims Pushed For Another Month
On March 30, 2020, a Japanese court approved extending a rehabilitation plan allowing creditors to receive their remaining bitcoin.
Hoâ€¦

entry.title: THNDR Games Releases New Game To Earn Bitcoin Alongside Gaming Reputation System On Nostr
entry.summary: THNDR's new Sudoku and Tetris inspired mobile game â€œBitcoin Blocksâ€ lets players earn bitcoin while solving puzzles. THNDR Games has released a new Bitcoin game called Bitcoin Blocks, which allows players to test their problem-solving skills against others to win Bitcoin. The game is similar to Tetris and Sudoku, and is available on the THNDR mobile gaming platform. THNDR has also announced the Gaming Graph, a reputation and badging system that will allow players to earn badges that are tied to their identity and can be transferred to other ecosystems. â€œThe launch of Bitcoin Blocks marks an important milestone in the development of THNDR's mobile gaming platform,â€ the press release sent to Bitcoin Magazine states. The game is the first to showcase THNDR's social competitive layer and featuâ€¦

entry.title: ESG Analyst Daniel Batten Reveals Dynamic Charts Showing Bitcoinâ€™s 52.6% Sustainable Energy Use
entry.summary:
Environmental, social, and governance (ESG) analyst Daniel Batten said Tuesday that the computational backbone of the Bitcoin network now uses 52.6% sustainable energy. Batten and onchain analyst Willy Woo created Dynamic Bitcoin ESG Charts to showcase the protocolâ€™s progress.
Contrary to Cambridge University Data, Analyst Says Bitcoin Mining Uses 52.6% Sustainable Energy
These days, there is significant debate regarding the environmental impact of Bitcoin mining. On March 7, 2023, ESG analyst Daniel Batten tweeted about new ESG charts he helped design with Willy Woo that show Bitcoinâ€™s progress toward using 52.6% sustainable energy. They also highlight total emissions, emissions per dollar, and emissions intensity.
Batten shared a sneak preview of the charts and noted that the datâ€¦

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.

entry.title: Yuga Twelvefold Bitcoin NFT Auction Raises $16.5 Million
entry.summary: The companyâ€™s collection of 300 generative art pieces garnered over 3,000 bids in 24 hours.

entry.title: What Is a Sovereign Rollup? Rollkit Pitches Second Layer for Bitcoin
entry.summary: Whether or not it's novel, it's another Bitcoin tool inspired by Ordinals.

entry.title: HermÃ¨s Seeks Stronger Block of MetaBirkins NFT Sales
entry.summary: After a legal victory against the NFT collection for trademark infringement, HermÃ¨s is asking a judge to force the collection offline permanently.

entry.title: Voyager Bankruptcy Judge Has Harsh Words for SEC's Objection to Binance Deal
entry.summary: The securities regulator has until tomorrow morning to come up with a more convincing argument against Voyagerâ€™s restructuring plan.

entry.title: Alameda Sues Grayscale Over $9 Billion Locked in Bitcoin Trust Shares
entry.summary: The FTX aliffiliate claims that Grayscaleâ€™s â€œimproperâ€ fund freeze means that customer cash has been lost.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term â€œmetaverseâ€ in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel â€œSnow Crash.â€ Now heâ€™s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in â€œSnow Crash,â€ goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."

entry.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'
entry.summary: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.

entry.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria
entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering nextâ€”including token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."

entry.title: What Attracted Artist Tom Sachs to NFTs? Community and Identity
entry.summary: Tom Sachs is a conceptual artist whose work has been displayed in museums and galleries all over the world, but he told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris he never before felt part of an art movementâ€”until he got into NFTs and Web3. He talked about Rocket Factory and the pull of Web3 art communities.
